text: The Val Verde Hotel, at 203 Manzanares St. in Socorro, New Mexico, was built in 1919. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1977. It is a U-shaped building, built of yellow concrete brick. It was designed in Mission Revival/Spanish Revival style, probably by architects Trost & Trost . With ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in Socorro County, New Mexico Category:Mission Revival architecture in New Mexico Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1919
title: Val Verde Hotel
